content: The Act may be cited as the "Global Free Internet Act of 2012". The Global Free Internet Act of 2012 emphasizes the importance of a single, open, global Internet for the free flow of information and products. It supports policies that encourage technology standards, respect user privacy, promote innovation, and avoid restricting Internet service providers. The Global Free Internet Act of 2012 aims to support a free, open Internet by promoting investment in Internet-related innovation, refraining from compelling restrictions on information flow, and allowing trade in Internet-related goods and services. Certain governments and international bodies are adopting policies that may undermine the open, global nature of the Internet by mandating unique technology standards favoring domestic producers. TASK FORCE ON THE GLOBAL INTERNET. The Task Force on the Global Internet, established within the executive branch by the Global Free Internet Act of 2012, consists of four US persons with expertise in Internet policy and civil liberties, nominated by the public and appointed by the President. The Chairperson is selected from among the Task Force members.
